name: Dataview
description: A high-performance data index and query language over Markdown files, for https://obsidian.md/. Transform your vault into a database.
author: Michael Brenan
features: Query vault data with SQL-like syntax
review: Dataview is arguably the most powerful plugin for Obsidian when it comes to data management and querying. It transforms your vault into a queryable database, allowing you to create dynamic views of your notes. Perfect for project management, habit tracking, and content organization.

name: Templater
description: A template language that lets you insert variables and functions results into your notes. It will also let you execute JavaScript code manipulating those variables and functions.
author: SilentVoid13
review: Templater is essential for anyone who wants to automate note creation in Obsidian. It's incredibly flexible and powerful, allowing for complex template logic and automation.

name: Calendar
description: Simple calendar widget for Obsidian. Create and view daily notes with an intuitive calendar interface.
author: Liam Cain
review: The Calendar plugin provides a clean and intuitive way to manage daily notes. It's perfect for journaling and keeping track of your daily writing habits.

name: Kanban
description: Create markdown-backed Kanban boards in Obsidian. Manage your projects and tasks with a visual board interface.
author: Matthew Meyers
review: Kanban brings visual project management to Obsidian. While it's not as feature-rich as dedicated project management tools, it integrates seamlessly with your notes.

name: Excalidraw
description: An Obsidian plugin to edit and view Excalidraw drawings. Create beautiful hand-drawn diagrams directly in your notes.
author: Zsolt Viczian
review: Excalidraw is perfect for visual thinkers. It allows you to create beautiful, hand-drawn style diagrams that integrate perfectly with your notes. Essential for brainstorming and concept mapping.

name: Advanced Tables
description: Improved table navigation, formatting, and manipulation for Obsidian. Makes working with Markdown tables much easier.
author: Tony Grosinger
